benign.title: Benign Breast Tumor Report
benign.definition: A benign breast tumor is a non-cancerous growth that does not invade surrounding tissues or spread to other parts of the body.

common: Lump in the breast that is smooth and movable

risk_factors: Family history of benign breast disease

tests: Ultrasound (to differentiate solid vs. fluid-filled lumps)
diagnosis.follow_up: Regular monitoring every 6-12 months for changes in size or symptoms.

medical_treatment: Surgical removal (if the lump grows or causes discomfort)
Hormonal therapy in rare cases (e.g., Tamoxifen)

dietary_guidelines: Increase intake of fruits, vegetables, and whole grains
Reduce saturated fats and processed foods
Include omega-3 fatty acids (found in fish, flaxseeds, and walnuts)
emotional_wellness: Stay informed and consult a doctor if any changes occur
Join support groups for breast health awareness
Manage stress through yoga and meditation

malignant.title: Malignant Breast Cancer Report
malignant.definition: Malignant breast cancer refers to the presence of cancerous cells that can grow uncontrollably and spread to other parts of the body (metastasis).

common: Hard, irregularly shaped lump in the breast
Skin dimpling or thickening (peau dâ€™orange appearance)
Nipple inversion or discharge (bloody or clear)
Swollen lymph nodes in the armpit
advanced: Shortness of breath (if cancer affects lungs)

possible_causes: Previous history of breast cancer or abnormal cells

staging.Stage 1: Small localized tumor with no lymph node involvement
staging.Stage 2: Larger tumor or slight spread to lymph nodes
staging.Stage 3: Locally advanced cancer (lymph nodes and skin involvement)

dietary_guidelines: Increase intake of antioxidants (berries, green tea)
Consume lean proteins and high-fiber foods
Avoid processed foods and high-sugar intake

normal.title: Breast Health Report
normal.message: No signs of breast cancer detected. However, maintaining breast health is important for long-term well-being.
preventive_measures: Get regular mammograms (based on age and risk factors)
Follow a balanced diet rich in vegetables, lean proteins, and healthy fats
Stay physically active and maintain a healthy BMI
when_to_consult_doctor: If you notice sudden lumps or changes in breast shape
Unusual nipple discharge or skin changes
lifestyle_tips: Wear a properly fitting bra for breast support
Manage stress through yoga, meditation, and regular exercise
